DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Mastectomy SLNB Positive Axillary Lymph Node Count Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable for questions addressing the number of lymph nodes in the area of the armpit in which cancerous cells have been detected after treatment or action taken to prevent or treat disease by mastectomy and the surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, as outlined in the study protocol to allow a person to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Mastectomy Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Positive Axillary Lymph Node Count Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Intervention or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Surgical removal of the breast._Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer._A lymph node in the area of the armpit (axilla) to which cancer has spread. This spread is determined by surgically removing some of the lymph nodes and examining them under a microscope to see whether cancer cells are present._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Property.preferredName: Mastectomy Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Positive Axillary Lymph Node Count Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.:Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.:A lymph node in the area of the armpit (axilla) to which cancer has spread. This spread is determined by surgically removing some of the lymph nodes and examining them under a microscope to see whether cancer cells are present.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

A lymph node in the area of the armpit (axilla) to which cancer has spread. This spread is determined by surgically removing some of the lymph nodes and examining them under a microscope to see whether cancer cells are present.
Determining the number or amount of something.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient was treated by mas
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient was treated by mastectomy and SLNB alone, patient has only 1 positive axillary node (macrometastases, greater than 2 mm).
